alert.note: Alert for Carteret; Craven; Pamlico (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 2:40PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of eastern North Carolina, including the following counties, Carteret, Craven and Pamlico. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 238 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Havelock, Cedar Island, South River, Merrimon, Harlowe, Florence, Whortonsville, Great Neck, Janeiro, North Harlowe, Merritt, Minnesott Beach Ferry, Cherry Branch Ferry Terminal, Cedar Island Ferry Terminal, Arapahoe, Minnesott Beach, Vandemere and Mesic. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
